title: Drawing, "Design for Woven Textile-Linline, Series #440", 1959
signed: In graphite, lower right: ALEXANDER GIRARD / ARCHITECT
inscribed: In graphite, upper left: BLACK STRIPE; in graphite, below design each stripe is numbered 1 through 6 with the word "color" below; in graphite, below design: THIS DRAWING ACTUAL SIZE OF PATTERN; in graphite, lower right in block: DATE: 25 FEB 1959/ SCALE: 1:1 / BY: pd / Job No. / Drawings No./ ALEXANDER GIRARD / ARCHITECT / P.O.BOX 707 / SANTE FE, NEW MEXICO
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of eighteen vertical columns with narrow horizontal stripes between two blank spaces, separated by thin vertical lines

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Woven Textile-Linline, Series #440", 1959.Graphite on white tracing paper. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-294.
